newsitem.title: USA: Clinton leaves for swearing-in at U.S. Capitol.
newsitem.headline: Clinton leaves for swearing-in at U.S. Capitol.

text.p: President Bill Clinton left the White House for the U.S. Capitol on Monday to take the oath of office for a second four-year term as leader of the world's most powerful country.

Clinton was accompanied by congressional leaders of both parties as he boarded his armoured limousine for a 10-minute ride up Pennsylvania Avenue to be sworn in by Supreme Court Justice William Rehnquist at noon EST (1700 GMT).
